bill_title: require certain intrastate railroads to place reflective materials on certain railroad cars.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain intrastate railroads to place reflective materials on certain railroad cars. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 49-16A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any intrastate railroad, including the D & I Railroad, the Ellis and Eastern Railroad, the Sisseton-Milbank Railroad, and the Dakota Southern Railroad, that operates primarily within the state shall place reflectors, reflective tape, or luminescent paint on each of the railroad cars that it owns and operates in the state. The reflectors, tape, or paint shall be placed on both sides of a railroad car in the front, middle, and rear of the railroad car so that it reflects the headlights of any motor vehicle approaching from the side. Any intrastate railroad that crosses a public highway in the state without the reflectors, tape, or paint required by this section is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
